Package nl.nikhef.jgridstart.gui

Class ActionViewRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.AbstractAction
      • nl.nikhef.jgridstart.gui.CertificateAction
        • nl.nikhef.jgridstart.gui.ActionViewRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ActionListener, ItemListener, Serializable, Cloneable, EventListener, Action, ListSelectionListener
    public class ActionViewRequest
extends CertificateAction
    Show the request wizard for an existing certificate.

    Shows the "request new" wizard from ActionRequest, but this action just views the form of the currently selected certificate and doesn't create a new one.

    The currently shown step is derived from its state. Alternatively, the action can be invoked with a number (as string) in the actioncommand to display a specified step.

    Author:
    wvengen
    See Also:
    ActionRequest, Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • wantsEnabled

        public boolean wantsEnabled()
        Description copied from class: CertificateAction
        Returns whether this action should be enabled or not.

        This is called when the selection changes and updates the enabled-state. It is not possible to just override the AbstractAction.isEnabled() method Swing gets confused about the enabled-ness of connected components when AbstractAction.isEnabled() is modified. By default it just returns isEnabled(), so the behaviour is unchanged from an ordinary Action.

        Overrides:
        wantsEnabled in class CertificateAction
